Detailed Description

Obsolete - use the classes ItemMenu or ItemTree instead, as they allow in an easier but more flexible way the creation of a menu-tree.

Member Function Documentation

void Menu::Back (   )  [virtual]
 

Invokes the menu to go one level back.

void Menu::ChangeMenuAccessor (  AbstractMenuAccessor *  accessor,
BOOLEAN  is_sub_accessor = FALSE
)  [virtual]
 

Changes the accessor of the menu to accessor. For traversing the menu hierarchy it is recommended to use the methods Menu::Trigger and Menu::Back, the method ChangeMenuAccessor is meant to replace a current menu accessor by another one and is usually only used by customized implementations of the class AbstractMenuAccessor. It should not be necessary for the application developer to invoke this method.

Parameters:
accessor Pointer to the new accessor.
is_sub_accessor If set to FALSE, the current accessor will be replaced by accessor. If set to TRUE, accessor will be embedded as sub-accessor to the current accessor.

void Menu::Trigger (  INT  index = -1  )  [virtual]
 

Invokes the menu to trigger the currently selected item. This meens that the menu automatically changes in presence of a submenu. Per default the selected item is triggered.

Parameters:
index Index of the item which should get triggered. If the index is < 0, the selected item is triggered.

void Menu::UpdateItemCount (   ) 
 

The menu buffers the number of items for efficiency reasons. If the number of menu-items in the menu-accessor are changed, this method must be invoked to get a consistent state.
